markdownRemark.html:
Problem statement

Having list of data frames with the same column names we would like to flatten (bind) them into a single data frame.

Tip: do.call

do.call is a R built-in function that takes two arguments:

  • name of a function to call,
  • list of parameters that are to be passed into a function (one by one).

Final call: do.call("name", list).

Example

If you want to combine arbitrary number of vectors into a single vector you could do:

do.call("c", list(c(1, 2), c(3, 4), ...))

Solution

f    == "rbind"
list == our list of data frames
q.e.d

do.call("rbind", list)

Sample code

means <- sapply(df, mean)
df_list <- lapply(df, 1, function(x) x - means)

do.call("rbind", df_list)
